Posts.Content: Kymberlyn wrote: I'm so confused that I don't even know what category I belong in on these forums. History - Oct 07, rt breast biopsy and lumpectoy for an abnormal/precancer lump, 1 cm. April 16, 08 - left breast this time, biopsy dx comes back with cancer, surgeon says stage 1, e+, p+, her-(or whatever those letters were).  Order mri, bone scan, blood tests, chest x-ray and sends me to a breast navigator.  No one tells me anything.  Next he sends me to an onocologist who shows me a video and wants me to sign for a lumpectomy with that ballon type radiation even though surgeon said earlier that I had choices of this, lumpectomy with rad or masectomy with rad.  I ask onc about results from all the tests.  He says that he hasn't even looked at them.  I question him some more and he got upset.  He pushed himself back in his chair, threw his hands behind his head and said, "This is the United States.  I guess you have a right to choose anything you want.  It's your life." I cried and walked out.  My husband came home from work and demanded a second opinion.  He called and had all my work transferred to this big Cancer Institute about 90 minutes away from us.  They finally got half my paper work.  I have to run around picking up films before I go there but they can't even fit me in with a nurse until June 30. What am I suppose to do?  Why can't someone just tell me what my tests show?  I'm ready to just quit and die or cut my own boobs off.  I can't stand the running around any more. Does anyone else feel this way?  How do you get through the waiting?  Do you worry that too much time is passing by?  Are you feeling more tender as the days go by?  Can you actually notice the difference in size since you first felt the lump? Does anyone ever finally come right out and tell you the truth?  What is the next step and when should I expect it? Dx 5/16/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I'm so confused Kymberlyn pip57

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2008 07:31AM Kymberlyn wrote: Thank you wishiwere.  I do feel better today.  And thanks Amber for also walking me through some of it.  I guess switching clinics will not be so hard.  Wayne, wow!  I think if I was rushed through that fast I might have been more scared because its hard for things to sink in with me.  I can only digest one thought at a time.  Well, at least I'm not alone with this.  It's a comfort to have so many people on these forums who care about each other.  Thanks for the rational thoughts.
Posts.Title: I'm so confused Kymberlyn pip57

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2008 12:51AM Kymberlyn wrote: Suz, thanks so much for the picture.  It's encouraging.  I start chemo tomorrow and so far the most upsetting part for me is the hair loss.  You sound so possitive.  It's comforting.  Thanks. Kym
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2008 11:59PM Kymberlyn wrote: Hi Everyone!  I'm back.  I'm sore as heck and horribly disfigured but they say this is good for me.  It's great to hear that you are all doing so well.   Lorena B, my mastectomy was 7 days ago and my drain is still in.  I'm jealous  to hear that you have yours out all ready.  I don't know what your bs would say about driving but mine has the same answer for everything... "If it doesn't hurt it won't cause harm.  If it hurts then don't do it."  Of course you have to be off your pain meds before you drive. How do you feel?  Are you off the pain meds and feeling strong enough to grip the wheel and alert enough to respond to an emergency? ControlMyDestiny... it sounds like you have been through a lot in a short time.  My situation was so opposite.  It took 5 weeks from diagnosis to finally scheduling a mastectomy.  I was freaking out.  I could swear I felt that bugger growing every day.  (invasive ductal carcinoma)  But as for now, like you, I'm waiting for the next tests.  Come what may, our faith will lead us where we need to be.  I wish you all the best. As for me... I need more time to absorb all that is happening.  I'll check the boards again in a few days.  Stay well everyone.  Believe it or not I think of you this list rather often.  I have learned a great deal here... and have blown off a little steam too (thanks for letting me do that).  Hugs, Kym
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2008 04:41PM - edited Jul 21, 2008 04:42PM by Kymberlyn My surgery was June 24th and I still have my drain tubes and bag.  It's been 4 weeks and I'm still collecting an average of 45cc.  Doc says he won't remove it until I'm at 15cc for at least 3-4 days in a row. Am I doing something that is causing so much fluid?  Should I be relaxing more and working less?  I'm running a farm so I have to work somewhat.  If I hire out some help and take the time to just sit around would my drainage lessen/healing quicken? I need a shower! Kym
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 11:14PM Kymberlyn wrote: We can add 1 more to the June list.  I was just scheduled for Tuesday, June 24th, left complete mastectomy with possible axilary whatever. I admire the strength all of you folks have.  I hope it rubs off on me.  <big smile>  I am no where near the point of wanting to pack or prepare my house yet.  Maybe I'll do that Monday night.
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2008 09:33AM Kymberlyn wrote: Hi Kathy, Thanks for the good wishes.  I got the path report call today.  The invasive little bugger was 3 cm upon removal (1< back in May) but all 3 nodes were negative!  I'm pretty sure this means that all the cancer is out of me.  Horay!  My next step is to see what the med onco wants to do with me.  Oh, and to get this drain out of course.  LOL Best wishes to you and everyone!
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2008 06:53PM Kymberlyn wrote: Hi Amy, It sounds like you are doing well.  Good luck at the ps today.  I'll be thinking of you. Kym

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2008 12:41AM Kymberlyn wrote: Hi Kathy, Thanks for the reply.  I'm not on any anti-biotics so that's probably why I was told to avoid showers.  Darn it. However, being busy people is something we do have in common.  I think I'll take it easy for a few days and see if I can heal up a little quicker. You had them for 5 weeks.  That had to be a bummer.  I'm sorry to hear that. Kym

Posts.Content: May 31, 2008 02:52AM Kymberlyn wrote: Hi Robyn, It's the opposite in our home.  Hubby is telling everyone - because he needs to talk about it (so I accept that).  But, I'm not ready to even tell my immediate family because it's a matter of me accepting it first.  Give your husband time.  I think he, like myself, will eventually grasp the reality of the whole thing. He's not hiding you.  He's denying it.
